author: T79
title: Old favourite
review:
When I was a child I had several of those 'building set with people' maxifig sets, and this one was my favourite.

Box/Instructions

Never had them, I probably received this one built as I remember I had it but I can not remember building it before.

Parts

Everything you need to build a tractor with front loader: the bucket has been used in lots of them, as were the big tyres. The road signs were always nice to have, they are actually in minifig scale but that just made them better!

Minifigures

Blue maxifigs with nice hats, one with a hammer and one driving the (by maxifig standards) tiny tractor. One weird thing I noticed between the maxifig sets I had is that there was no real standard: in one set the figures could be a brick taller than in another set, in this case leading to positively small workmen. Same with the arms, here the workmen have just one arm piece (so no elbows) while in other sets the figures have two. When seen with another set like #254 Family (with that massive baby carriage!) this makes it look like these workmen are actually children playing but I doubt that was the intention.

The build

Again an easy build, still slightly more involved than #214 Red Indians. And the parts were useful for making your own big (minifig) tractors.

The completed model

Par for the course, simple but recognizable. This was one of the more playable 'building set with people' I had, and that's why it was my favourite.

Overall opinion

History seems to repeat itself, as my children gravitate to this one in favour of the others like #200 and #254, just like I did. Though the theme itself must be more appealing to them as well, judging on how much they love #383 Truck with Excavator or #10657 My First Lego Set with its construction theme.
